commit 4207f51c12e23f276a96f5ab1560aca0c3192258
Author: Jamie Cansdale <jcansdale@github.com>
Date:   Wed Feb 6 11:39:52 2019 +0000

    Get the Git SccService before IGitActionsExt
    
    IGitActionsExt is proffered by SccProviderPackage, but isn't
    advertised. To ensure that getting IGitActionsExt doesn't return null,
    we first request the SccService which is advertised. This forces
    SccProviderPackage to load and proffer IGitActionsExt.

commit 1a0456d3af63f84b3da95558f83d412ba38c4767
Author: Jamie Cansdale <jcansdale@github.com>
Date:   Fri Feb 1 10:39:34 2019 +0000

    Update GitHub.TeamFoundation.16 to target .NET 4.7.2
    
    This project needs to compile against assemblies that target .NET 4.7.2.
    Because GitHub.VisualStudio targets .NET 4.6, it can no longer compile against GitHub.TeamFoundation.16.
    We now include GitHub.TeamFoundation.16.dll as content in GitHub.VisualStudio
    and change the MefComponent Asset to use a File rather than Project Source.

commit d46bd0d842fdbe21554f3a1c88391fb59d4341a7
Author: Jamie Cansdale <jcansdale@github.com>
Date:   Fri Feb 1 10:29:36 2019 +0000

    Use reflection to instantiate VSGitExt implementations
    
    We can't reference all of the GitHub.TeamFoundation.* projects at once, so instead
    we use reflection to retrieve and instantiate the appropriate VSGitExt implementation.

commit c53fa14a966fe66459bc69d6d4c11ba02517bb4e
Author: Steven Kirk <grokys@users.noreply.github.com>
Date:   Thu Jan 10 15:25:09 2019 +0100

    Fix displaying errors in GitHub pane.
    
    https://github.com/github/VisualStudio/pull/1787 refactored `InfoPanel` but didn't update `GitHubPaneView` with its new behavior. So:
    
    - Don't initialy set `infoPanel.Visibility` to `Collapsed`: `InfoPanel` will handle this itself
    - Set `ShowCloseButton` to show the `x` button to close the error
    
    Fixes #2172
    Fixes #2058

commit c0aa176d3b540412ac08ea27ec20cd87025bd39b
Merge: 11c9d3451 46fb5b529
Author: Jamie Cansdale <jcansdale@github.com>
Date:   Thu Jan 10 14:01:41 2019 +0000

    Don't send duplicate comment body.

commit 46fb5b529b4f6fe52247517bf8cdf9b08b9c163a
Author: Steven Kirk <grokys@users.noreply.github.com>
Date:   Thu Jan 10 14:10:28 2019 +0100

    Don't send duplicate comment body.
    
    When adding a PR review comment, don't send the `body` twice, as it causes the body to be repeated in the comment itself and the containing review.
    
    Fixes #2170

    ba8382400c4eb50039e12abf39550b23fe6e0233 changed `Browser.cs` to add a call to `ThreadHelper.ThrowIfNotOnUIThread();`. However it _also_ erroneously changed the code to not return the result of `service.CreateExternalWebBrowser` to the caller, breaking the browser on VS2015.

    Avoid using GraphQL repositories/ownerAffiliations

    RepositoryAffiliation?[], but ownerAffiliations doesn't currently exist
    on GitHub Enterprise. Luckily the default is Owner and Collaborator,
    which is what we need in this case (we can simply pass null).

commit 59feb1fecadb469d86dc79207aa5d17280a96c2d

commit dd34b3b9d2bdd57f7161614c50c0305ae5821347
Author: Jamie Cansdale <jcansdale@github.com>
Date:   Fri Dec 21 12:57:32 2018 +0000

    Set both affiliations and ownerAffiliations
    
    Explanation by @nicksnyder:
    
    Before this change, the affiliations field was overloaded to mean both
    the affiliations that the viewer had with the specified repositories,
    as well as the affiliations between the user that the connection was
    operating on. This caused a host of issues in various places, and we
    opted to separate them out to allow for more flexibility.
    
    In order to fix the above, the proper behavior would be to pass the
    full list of arguments to both connections (affiliations and
    ownerAffiliations), which should provide you all of the possible
    repositories.
    
    https://platform.github.community/t/unable-to-fetch-users-repositories-by-organization-membership/7557/6

commit a2eb5c262e0e133df99a4401dd095d20901a1ea8
Author: Jamie Cansdale <jcansdale@github.com>
Date:   Fri Dec 21 12:44:33 2018 +0000

    Include repositories contributed to in list

commit e161f115fd267dc06e23fd1a6b271d49f29c668c
Author: Jamie Cansdale <jcansdale@github.com>
Date:   Fri Dec 21 12:02:33 2018 +0000

    Warn when showing max number of repos in org

commit 4d31f659e702eeb85878d244f3bc85498e7b0f81
Author: Jamie Cansdale <jcansdale@github.com>
Date:   Fri Dec 21 09:23:13 2018 +0000

    Show max 100 recently pushed repos for each org
    
    Limit the number of repositories displayed for each org to the 100 most
    recently pushed ones. This should stop organizations with 1000s of
    repositories from having a disproportional impact on the load time.

commit 1f9eb5055f0495d782053aad0d2bd33d1512b9f6
Author: Steven Kirk <grokys@users.noreply.github.com>
Date:   Fri Dec 14 08:42:53 2018 +0100

    Suppress CA warnings where it makes sense.
    
    This is done in the cases:
    
    - Where the code comes from a 3rd party (e.g. `sqlite-net`, RxuiLegacy)
    - Where code represents P/Invoke or other external concepts
    - Where functionality implements a WPF feature which is not compatble with the warning (`VirtualizingList` etc)
    - CA2007 is disabled accoring to [VS guidelines](https://github.com/Microsoft/VSSDK-Analyzers/issues/95#issuecomment-447004367)

commit 040e2915f243428556f963b0b4ce8d58876bceaf
Author: Steven Kirk <grokys@users.noreply.github.com>
Date:   Fri Dec 14 08:42:53 2018 +0100

    Suppress CA warnings where it makes sense.
    
    This is done in the cases:
    
    - Where the code comes from a 3rd party (e.g. `sqlite-net`, RxuiLegacy)
    - Where code represents P/Invoke or other external concepts
    - Where functionality implements a WPF feature which is not compatble with the warning (`VirtualizingList` etc)
    - CA2007 is disabled accoring to [VS guidelines](https://github.com/Microsoft/VSSDK-Analyzers/issues/95#issuecomment-447004367)

commit defd9dd3340f610153aecdc6c6c0f3e9416e376f
Author: Steven Kirk <grokys@users.noreply.github.com>
Date:   Tue Dec 11 16:25:14 2018 +0100

    Set RxApp.DefaultExceptionHandler.
    
    Previously, exceptions thrown in `ReactiveCommand` execute methods would crash the application. Add a handler to `RxApp.DefaultExceptionHandler` to handle these exceptions and log them rather than crashing VS.
    
    We hook this up in the `ViewModelBase` static constructor don't want to force-load rx on package load.

commit f969094913a135580a08c8eeebe6ece9b650fb8c
Author: Jamie Cansdale <jcansdale@github.com>
Date:   Wed Dec 5 14:38:40 2018 +0000

    Avoid using async void for Invalidate

    async into a separate InvalidateAsync method.

commit 91fcd67d33863566aeb5629eb6a012d6f7482ea9
Author: Jamie Cansdale <jcansdale@github.com>
Date:   Wed Dec 5 13:29:51 2018 +0000

    Don't change button visibility if repo has changed
    
    There can be delay before IsAGitHubRepo returns its result. If the
    repository changes before the call returns, the button can end up with
    the visibility for the wrong repository.
    
    This fix only sets the button visibility if the repository hasn't
    changed. Button is invalidated multiple times, so one of them returns
    the visibility for the correct repository.

commit eb479025c6f7f6ff87fc041f3fce2bc6f731ec7e
Author: Jamie Cansdale <jcansdale@github.com>
Date:   Thu Nov 8 12:09:19 2018 +0000

    Avoid redundant repository change events
    
    Previously both TeamExplorerNavigationItemBase and TeamExplorerItemBase
    were listring for repository change events. This changes it so that
    only TeamExplorerItemBase needs to listen for change events.
    TeamExplorerNavigationItemBase needs to subscribe before the item is
    visible (the event is required to make it visible).

commit 18cc2db74c70af98ffdf2bd1360839889764c459
Author: Steven Kirk <grokys@users.noreply.github.com>

commit 8e2afe278130959bf352d96a870a6192210c60f0
Author: Steven Kirk <grokys@users.noreply.github.com>
Date:   Fri Nov 2 11:03:04 2018 +0100

    Fix draft appearing after sucessful submit.
    
    In certain situations, the inline comment thread was refreshed before the `DeleteDraft(comment)` line in `PullRequestReviewCommentThreadViewModel.PostComment` was run, meaning that the draft would be displayed _after_ the comment was succesfully submitted.
    
    Work around this by deleting the draft before submitting the comment, and if we get an error re-insert the draft.

commit 48dc7665c6e49849fb49f6d8670f423c2c1381e6
Author: Jamie Cansdale <jcansdale@github.com>
Date:   Fri Oct 26 09:37:10 2018 +0100

    Fix calling IGitActionsExt.CloneAsync from VS 2019
    
    The ServiceProgressData type is in a Visual Studio 2019 assembly that
    we don't currently have access to. Using reflection to call the
    CloneAsync in order to avoid conflicts with the Visual Studio 2017
    version. Progress won't be displayed on the status bar, but it appears
    prominently on the Team Explorer Home view.

commit d4f4ec34602388481b0bfa5829a714a1113848d3
Author: Jamie Cansdale <jcansdale@github.com>
Date:   Wed Oct 3 15:36:29 2018 +0100

    Optimize when forked from local branch
    
    Check for the common case where a branch was forked from a local
    branch. Use CommonAncestor because we don't want to search for a commit
    that only exists locally or that has been added to the remote tracking
    branch since the fork. This won't work if new commits have been pulled
    to forked from branch.

commit 1f2f591d1eff9368e82b42039c6d0d5b453d0277
Author: Steven Kirk <grokys@users.noreply.github.com>
Date:   Tue Oct 2 15:38:36 2018 +0200

    Get unit tests passing again.
    
    - Explictly set current thread scheduler as `RxApp.MainThreadScheduler`
    in many tests. Seems that the behaviour of `MainThreadScheduler` has
    changed in some subtle way?
    - Explicitly clear `PullRequestDetailViewModel.OperationError` in the
    methods for each command. Seems `ReactiveCommand.IsExecuting` can now
    signal _after_ `ThrowExceptions`, making the error be immediately cleared.
    - Don't pass null commands to `Observable.Merge` in
    `LoginCredentialsViewModel`. It doesn't like that.

commit 3d2b5806089df9ee17cd0dfc3c14fb5f946b5663
Author: Jamie Cansdale <jcansdale@github.com>
Date:   Wed Sep 26 14:41:15 2018 +0100

    Consolidate PathError into PathWarning
    
    There was an issue with PathError appearing at the top. When the error
    appeared, the repository list would move down causing a different
    repository to be selected. This would clause flickering between two
    repositories.
    
    This commit consolidates PathError into PathWarning (which appears
    above the path which is being validated).  This avoids the flicker and
    puts the warning next to the text box which it applies to.
    
    The logic to block clone or open when there is a file in the way has
    been moved to the commands' `canExecute` observable.

commit 871c112422652d7f9c93ca7c12b43d5b585530bd
Author: Jamie Cansdale <jcansdale@github.com>
Date:   Tue Sep 25 10:44:05 2018 +0100

    Fix for crash when search includes white-space
    
    SearchAsync will crash the process if we send it a duplicate string.
    There is a SearchTrimsWhitespace setting that makes searched with
    leading or trailing white-space appear as duplicates. We compare the
    query with trimmed white-space to avoid this.

Author: Jamie Cansdale <jcansdale@github.com>
Date:   Mon Sep 24 12:41:08 2018 +0100

    Simplify IncrementCounter assert
    
    When the assert fails it will look like this:
    ```
    Test
    'IncrementCounter_Showing_Default_Tab("https://enterprise.com",True,1,"xxx")'
     failed:
     NSubstitute.Exceptions.ReceivedCallsException : Expected to receive
    exactly 1 call matching:
     IncrementCounter(x => (Convert(x.Body).Member.Name ==
    value(GitHub.App.UnitTests.ViewModels.Dialog.Clone.RepositoryCloneViewModelTests+<>c__DisplayClass2_0).counterName))
    Actually received no matching calls.
    Received 1 non-matching call (non-matching arguments indicated with '*'
    characters):
     IncrementCounter(*model => model.NumberOfCloneViewUrlTab*)
    ```

    Install for VS 2017 when version reported as 1.x

    we're installing for Visual Studio 2017.

commit 646fad4550ec103ca780b76f897093cb8106d6fe
Author: Jamie Cansdale <jcansdale@github.com>
Date:   Thu Aug 23 09:56:34 2018 +0100

    No TargetVersion for GitHub.TeamFoundation.15
    
    Don't specify a target Visual Studio version for the
    GitHub.TeamFoundation.15 MEF assembly.
    
    Specifying a TargetVersion was causing it to sometimes incorrectly be
    excluded when installed on some Visual Studio 2017 versions.
    
    We can leave TargetVersion on the GitHub.TeamFoundation.14 MEF assembly
    because this attribute isn't supported on Visual Studio 2015 and we do
    want it excluded on Visual Studio 2017.
    
    This is a workaround for #1859.

Author: Meaghan Lewis <meaghanlewis@github.com>

commit 3b688f88423552f3d912f46a3fa9f8637b6a0709
Author: Steven Kirk <grokys@users.noreply.github.com>
Date:   Tue Aug 7 13:24:04 2018 +0200

    Only update PR list state on main thread.
    
    `IVirtualizingListSource.IsLoading` can be signalled on a background thread. This was causing a deadlock in #1828. Make sure we call `IssueListViewModelBase.UpdateState` on the UI thread.
    
    Fixes #1828

    this with an inline XAML GitHub logo.

    - Added functionality to the InlineCommentPeekService to dismiss the session when that event is fired
    
    Co-authored-by: Steven Kirk <grokys@users.noreply.github.com>

commit 39f3a5407dfa350051e636b19a20b4ce7684b5e7
Author: Jamie Cansdale <jcansdale@github.com>
Date:   Wed Jul 4 09:47:26 2018 +0100

    Rename Treeish to TreeishPath
    
    GitHub URLs combine branches/SHAs and tree paths.
    
    For example:
    https://github.com/github/visualstudio/tree/master/src
    
    Git would represent "master/src" as the tree-ish "master:src". Because
    looking at the URL we don't know where the branch stops and the tree
    starts, "master/src" is being stored as the TreeishPath property.

commit 2d55511c3cb41ad6d19fee7a8b671d163cad7a08
Author: Steven Kirk <grokys@users.noreply.github.com>
Date:   Tue Jun 26 16:56:15 2018 +0200

    Remove PCL akavache and splat libs.
    
    Having them be PCL meant that we had to have both a PCL and .netfx version of Splat, which was causing problems with test runners because they would load the wrong version of the library at random.
    
    Related: https://github.com/editor-tools/Akavache/pull/2

    Add IsWorkingDirectoryClean test for missing file
    
    Files can sometimes show up as DeletedFromWorkdir but not appear on
    Team Explorer or when `git status` is executed.
    
    Since there is no reason to block a checkout when a file is missing,
    IsWorkingDirectoryClean should return true when a file has been deleted.

    {

    });

commit e9b501fa5c697706f9e64045358dacc8cc916b80
Author: Steven Kirk <grokys@gmail.com>
Date:   Fri Apr 13 17:17:44 2018 +0200

    Pass IPackageSettings to UsageTracker ctor.
    
    `UsageTracker` was querying `IPackageSettings` in its initialization and this was causing an occasional race condition between `AsyncPackage.AddService` and `GetService`.  Instead pass the `IPackageSettings` to the `UsageTracker` constructor.

    Sigh. Seems that hyperlinks don't respect dependency property precedence, so the `IsEnabled=False` trigger for `Hyperlink.Foreground` doesn't override the foreground `TemplateBinding`. commit 223e904f5048769def8a4e97dedc2c1615cb90ac
Author: Steven Kirk <grokys@gmail.com>

commit 24dec7d880f1bfe0e567fece05704d5ca9ed47b1
Author: Steven Kirk <grokys@gmail.com>
Date:   Thu Apr 5 11:19:29 2018 +0200

    Reuse existing diff tabs.
    
    This requires that when we extract a file to a temp file, that the same file at the same commit is always extracted to the same location. To do this, we use a hash of the file's relative path in the repository and the encoding as the temp directory name, and place the commit sha in the temp file's filename.

commit 050411969d32614237346c4fec152f6a0d303eac
Author: Jamie Cansdale <jcansdale@github.com>
Date:   Wed Apr 4 16:24:24 2018 +0100

    This page is intentionally left blank

commit a9c5c16e78241fceda8bc1fbe6d03ad46ab81067
Author: Jamie Cansdale <jcansdale@github.com>
Date:   Wed Apr 4 16:18:48 2018 +0100

    Use JoinableTask rather than TaskCompletionSource
    
    This avoids the risk deadlock if called within the context of a JTF.Run delegate.
    https://github.com/Microsoft/vs-threading/blob/master/doc/threading_rules.md#rule-3-if-ever-awaiting-work-that-was-started-earlier-that-work-must-be-joined
    https://blogs.msdn.microsoft.com/andrewarnottms/2014/05/07/asynchronous-and-multithreaded-programming-within-vs-using-the-joinabletaskfactory/

commit 1a867f8474b9eb214dae421482139a816061961f
Author: Steven Kirk <grokys@gmail.com>
Date:   Wed Apr 4 12:43:53 2018 +0200

    Validate PR review state before submit.
    
    Split the `PullRequestReviewAuthoringViewModel.Submit` command into 2 separate commands and add a `CanExecute` observable for them:
    
    - `Approve` can always be submitted
    - `Comment` needs either a review body or >0 review comments
    - `RequestChanges` always needs a review body

    Don't use SwitchToMainThreadAsync to avoid potential hang

    Don't auto-load in background to prevent potential SwitchToMainThreadAsync hang.

    Assume enterprise user/pass login available.
    
    If the enterprise server doesn't return a value for `VerifiablePasswordAuthentication`, or the `api/meta` endpoint fails completely then we're on an older version of enterprise. In this case assume username and password login is available as we have no way to tell.
    
    Fixes #1474

    Normalize nunit packages.
    
    We previously had dependencies on a bunch of packages that were nunit2-based, and in addition Test Explorer was only finding tests in the TrackingCollectionTests project. This commit removes the nunit2 packages and installs the `NUnit3TestAdapter.3` package which allows Test Explorer to find all our tests.

Author: Steven Kirk <grokys@gmail.com>
Date:   Fri Feb 9 13:35:00 2018 +0100

    Prevent PullRequestSessionManager.StatusChanged throwing
    
    `PullRequestSessionManager.StatusChanged` was throwing when the repository status changed because it was trying to set `initialized` when the task is already completed. Use `TrySetResult` which doesn't throw when the task has already completed.

commit f55c19e1744fbdae79160e7e866dcc3610f31d2b
Author: Steven Kirk <grokys@gmail.com>
Date:   Tue Dec 12 15:47:22 2017 +0100

    Relax the GitHub pane URL regex.
    
    Fix the GitHub pane URL regex that was causing #1376.
    
    Although the actual regex for validating GitHub usernames and repository names are more complex than this, we're not actually _validating_ them, we just want to be able to parse them. The new regex, `[\w_.-]+` should encompass all valid usernames and repo names I think.
    
    Fixes #1376

commit e7144520b5dcec051c35ec30c4d13e012ac85ab4
Author: Steven Kirk <grokys@gmail.com>
Date:   Thu Nov 9 17:30:28 2017 +0100

    Correctly compare repository full name.
    
    Fixes opening links on enterprise instances.
    
    Previously we were comparing `repo.FullName == ActiveRepo.Name` which always failed as `repo.FullName` returns `owner/name` whereas `ActiveRepo.Name` just returns the `name` portion. Construct a full name for the active repo and check that.
    
    Fixes #1291

commit 3ef8a8ed4e41ee55a86965a7707a892fe080a12e
Author: Jamie Cansdale <jcansdale@gmail.com>
Date:   Tue Nov 7 15:50:01 2017 +0000

    Check for repo status when we don't allow PR checkout
    
    We don't allow checkout when:
    A file has been added to index
    A file has been modified in working dir
    A file has been staged
    A file is missing from working dir
    A file has been removed from index
    A file has been renamed in index
    A file has been renamed in working dir
    
    We do allow checkout when:
    The index and working dir is unaltered since last commit
    There are untracked files

    Removed `IConnection.Repositories`.
    
    Removed `IConnection.Repositories` and `IConnectionManager.RefreshRepositories` and replaced them with `LocalRepositories` which acts as a central place to find known repositories.

Author: Steven Kirk <grokys@gmail.com>
Date:   Thu Sep 14 22:15:55 2017 +0200

    Fix diff parsing.
    
    If we pass a `LibGit2Sharp.Patch` to `DiffUtilities.ParseFragment` it includes a header that should not be counted when calculating `DiffLine`. Make the parser ignore diff content before the first diff chunk header.

Date:   Fri Sep 8 14:33:31 2017 +0200

    Pre-fill PR title/description.

    Fixes #767
    Fixes #997

commit ef22d3bd96919c95c206324b50b5691301f1a0e8
Author: Jamie Cansdale <jcansdale@gmail.com>
Date:   Fri Sep 8 11:39:05 2017 +0100

    Avoid logging during assembly resolve event
    
    Assembly resolving should be as quick and side effect free as possible.
    It's best to avoid triggering assembly loads or writing to disk during assembly resolves.
    This change delays writing to the log until the package is being disposed.

commit d5422181b363a998d1e2b6741ad366719b6b2e7d
Author: Jamie Cansdale <jcansdale@gmail.com>
Date:   Fri Sep 8 10:36:17 2017 +0100

    Write to log if assembly is resolved
    
    This should only happen if installer has failed or running unsigned build.

commit 15802f506144d37aab863aa61baaf1b3b2fbf5d8
Author: Steven Kirk <grokys@gmail.com>
Date:   Thu Sep 7 18:53:26 2017 +0200

    Don't initialize at the top of `TimerTick`.
    
    The first tick will call `IncrementLaunchCount` which will call `LoadUsage` which will call `Initialize` for us.

commit 9ee7fa1e2cd1ab9189e5d2351df886fa74d03acc
Author: Jamie Cansdale <jcansdale@gmail.com>
Date:   Tue Sep 5 16:30:02 2017 +0100

    Add test and comments about PR base/head fetch order
    
    The PR base branch might no longer exist, so we fetch using `refs/pull/<PR>/head` first.
    This will often fetch the base commits, even when the base branch no longer exists.

commit 38d6cfe8fcaa8405b84767bacf240b10ebea7436
Author: Steven Kirk <grokys@gmail.com>
Date:   Tue Sep 5 17:08:21 2017 +0200

    `.cshtml` files have a projection buffer which is the contents of the generated C#. Don't use this as a content source for diff matching as it's completely different to the file in git.

    Handle inline comments in projection buffers.
    
    Previously we were crashing trying to show inline comments when a projection buffer was opened in a diff. Don't crash, and actually show inline comments.
    
    Fixes #1186

commit 6dcd9574bb8fe88490d71f79a442ae82c42a9cec
Author: Steven Kirk <grokys@gmail.com>
Date:   Mon Aug 7 17:03:13 2017 +0200

    Add message for pending review comments.
    
    If the user has pending review comments on the server then we can't post new comments. The correct way to test for this would be to make a request to `/repos/:owner/:repo/pulls/:number/reviews` and check for comments with a `PENDING` state. For the moment however we'll just display a message.

commit b544b46abe31569d34b8e3a42e77904cb8110a4e
Author: Steven Kirk <grokys@gmail.com>
Date:   Mon Aug 7 16:29:11 2017 +0200

    Fix PR details busy indication.
    
    #934 changed the behavior of the PR details view such that when loading for the first time it should display the circular spinner, and refreshing should display the indeterminate progress bar at the top of the view.
    
    This got broken at some point and the circular spinner is currently displayed on refresh. This fixes that so that the indeterminate progress bar at the top of the view is displayed again when refreshing.

commit c21fa052067621377b0cd1320dbc732c989b36dc
Author: Andreia Gaita <shana@spoiledcat.net>
Date:   Fri Aug 4 00:10:14 2017 +0200

    It is apparently too much to ask for nuget to clean up after itself

commit b8b803ff16b8723d1825de1ed64ea75f711d4da0
Author: Andreia Gaita <shana@spoiledcat.net>
Date:   Thu Aug 3 23:59:40 2017 +0200

    Use custom signed build of Markdown.Wpf
    
    StrongNameSigner is not doing enough when signing unsigned assemblies to allow xaml to properly reference signed assemblies, and things fail at runtime.
    
    Markdig has a signed version of their package, so we're reverting to a custom build of Markdig.Wpf - https://github.com/editor-tools/markdig-wpf/releases/tag/v0.2.1 - that references the Markdig.Signed package and is also signed.
    
    Also add ProvideCodeBase to ensure that these DLLs are found at runtime.

commit 2acec7c44120759c345b3395b1ef5c276ef9df28
Author: Andreia Gaita <shana@spoiledcat.net>
Date:   Thu Aug 3 23:56:17 2017 +0200

    Markdown should not be included in the shared dictionary
    
    The SharedDictionary in GitHub.UI is the lowest level of controls and is included in all the Team Explorer views (Home, Connect, etc). Therefore it should not bring in any external dependencies that cause other libraries to get loaded. Since markdown.xaml requires Markdig now, it should be referenced only in the views that use it.

commit 1fdee699103904498a8fd41c79d90bb0f2bd6c0b
Author: Andreia Gaita <shana@spoiledcat.net>
Date:   Thu Aug 3 23:29:18 2017 +0200

    Add signing alternative for external builds

    These are exposed via `ThemeDesignTime.xaml` and `DesignTimeResources.xaml` (for pages that don't explicitly locate resources).

    Attempt to fix #1060

commit 23eb706a50a1fd8d761818775d8e12fca65f383b
Author: Jamie Cansdale <jcansdale@gmail.com>
Date:   Thu Jun 29 18:39:30 2017 +0100

    Cache the IEditorFormatMap properties not brushes
    
    Because the brushes were being cached, the glyph background colors weren't being refreshed when the theme changed.
    I was concerned about the performance/memory implications of merging a ResourceDictionary with each glyph (hence the revert).
    In this commit each glyph has its Background set after creation.

commit 5045e331518e5174c30ba22811e577677f8f3174
Author: Jamie Cansdale <jcansdale@gmail.com>
Date:   Thu Jun 29 18:04:01 2017 +0100

    Revert "Fix design time warnings using DesignTimeResources.xaml"
    
    This reverts commit e8c20ba0eaf258e2533e629f8e8605be31a69916.

commit acca60cf7ca6c1d7e8e7da4b14295b8548b3a640
Author: Steven Kirk <grokys@gmail.com>
Date:   Thu Jun 29 18:55:52 2017 +0200

    Added a version to host cache.
    
    In #1021 we require the repository parent (in the case of forked repositories) - this data is returned from the API but wasn't getting stored in our cache, meaning that we have invalid data when data is returned from the cache as opposed to from the API.
    
    This adds a `cacheVersion` to host caches. This version is checked when the host cache is first loaded, and if it doesn't match the expected version, the cache is invalidated. In this way each time we make a change as required by #1021 we can bump `HostCacheFactory.CacheVersion` to ensure the cache won't be returning invalid data.

    Only allow commenting on deleted lines on LHS.
    
    On the left-hand-side of a diff view, only allow commenting on lines that were actually deleted, otherwise the comment will jump across to the right hand side when it's added.

commit 6efbcb4a67dfbade61566c074984c309c304edea
Author: Steven Kirk <grokys@gmail.com>
Date:   Wed May 24 13:02:49 2017 +0200

    Added locking around GetFile.
    
    The diff view was causing it to be called twice concurrently, meaning that there was sometimes a race between `fileIndex.TryGetValue` and `fileIndex.Add`.

commit 083d8a28b4b16ff5cf9859fc89583074ef80624b
Author: Steven Kirk <grokys@gmail.com>
Date:   Thu May 4 21:52:53 2017 +0200

    Add a delay to the login process.
    
    We're getting a lot of reports of failed logins, and looking at the logs
    it appears that using a token immediately after it's given out can fail.
    Add a delay of 1s (I tried less but this seems to give the best results)
    before reading `/user` after authorization.

    Use ProvideBindingRedirection for GHfVS assemblies
    
    Redirect to the latest `GitHub.*` assembly for assemblies that require a CodeBase (e.g. `GitHub.Exports`).
    This makes extensions that don't depend on a specific GHfVS version possible.

commit ef501a9baf5b4e62dc283f411da0b55d49e9eca4
Author: Steven Kirk <grokys@gmail.com>
Date:   Mon Apr 24 11:14:29 2017 +0200

    Added hack to pass path to tagger for diff view.
    
    `IVsDifferenceService.OpenComparisonWindow2` doesn't allow us to pass
    extra information to the tagger, such as the path to the file being
    tagged (the left file path is always passed, which may be a temp file).
    Hack around this by storing global state in the pull request review
    session object (ugh).

commit be21f87086adeff7cd4bd7ff43b984b8bb35ce38
Author: Steven Kirk <grokys@gmail.com>
Date:   Thu Apr 20 14:37:22 2017 +0200

    IGitClient.ExtractFile returns file contents.
    
    Previously we always needed file contents in a temporary file, but with
    inline comments we don't need a temporary file, so make
    `IGitClient.ExtractFile` return a string containing the file contents
    instead of a temp file path, and move the temp file stuff to
    PullRequestService.ExtractDiffFiles.

commit bb6aa7ef28279e9b97207e56a96503f5e575f712
Author: Steven Kirk <grokys@gmail.com>
Date:   Fri Apr 7 15:12:52 2017 +0200

    Parse diffs to get real line numbers for comments.
    
    The `PullRequestReviewComment.Position` field refers to a line number in
    the diff between the PR `Head` and `Base`. Generate and parse this diff
    to get the line number in the file at which the comment should be
    placed.

commit 8a47e987ecf27e82acb3378ea8c26a18dc2bfa8f
Author: Jamie Cansdale <jcansdale@gmail.com>
Date:   Sat Apr 1 11:28:45 2017 +0100

    Mega refactoring of SharedDictionaryManager
    
    Move all caching and loading responsibilities into SharedDictionaryManagerBase.
    Move theme support into ThemeDictionaryManager.
    Always add ResourceDictionary to MergedDictionaries (not just when there is a cache hit).
    Allow `Source` to be set multiple times to swap out ResourceDictionary (used when changing theme).

commit bde12b7bfb823bf9997cd3f3d437b71988d70f6d
Author: Jamie Cansdale <jcansdale@gmail.com>
Date:   Fri Mar 31 09:22:08 2017 +0100

    Convert all Source `file` URIs to `pack`
    
    Any XAML that uses a custom class needs be loaded from a `pack` URI so the assembly for the custom class can be found. This makes it convert all `file` URIs, not just ones containing `SharedDictionary.xaml`.

commit 7cf156588c1b832bfeef5cef609e54be3fc2f64b
Author: Jamie Cansdale <jcansdale@gmail.com>
Date:   Thu Mar 30 21:29:41 2017 +0100

    Make SharedDictionaryManager work at design time
    
    Design time uses `file` URIs that don't work with custom `ResourceDictionary` implementations.
    They need to be transformed to a `pack` URI so that the assembly that implements the custom
    `ResourceDictionary` (in this case `SharedDictionaryManager`) can be found.

commit 78db63de1098f64379965fbd2c3ca07e0dd22d65
Merge: 0575a19ef 91aa2eada
Author: Steven Kirk <grokys@users.noreply.github.com>
Date:   Wed Mar 29 16:09:20 2017 +0200

    Merge branch 'master' into grokys/refactor-view-base

commit 0575a19ef9144f569d9ebd482950a52c0eb8befd
Author: Steven Kirk <grokys@gmail.com>
Date:   Wed Mar 29 14:02:51 2017 +0200

    Merge SimpleUserControl and BusyStateView.
    
    Merges `SimpleUserControl` and `BusyStateView` into a single `ViewBase`
    control. This control will automatically display a spinner if the view
    model implements `IHasLoading` and `IsLoading` is true, and an
    intermediate progress bar if the view model implements `IHasBusy` and
    `IsBusy` is true. If the view model implements neither of these
    interfaces, then it will act the same as a standard `UserControl`.

commit 5ede6bcf8b1dc42c8dfea8ab29ab72859574247d
Author: Steven Kirk <grokys@gmail.com>
Date:   Wed Mar 22 19:19:53 2017 +0100

    Make `ChangedFilesTree` a read-only list.
    
    Rather than using a reactive list and clearing and rebuilding on
    refresh, expose a read-only list and completely replace it on refresh.
    This prevents the UI jumping around as the list is cleared and rebuilt.

commit abc1415284d990852d265ebc9ba4e94092fe1669
Author: Steven Kirk <grokys@gmail.com>
Date:   Wed Mar 22 18:56:40 2017 +0100

    Don't hide content when refreshing PR details.
    
    Added a new `IHasLoading` interface in addition to `IHasBusy` and use
    `IsLoading` when the PR details pane is initially loading and then
    `IsBusy` afterwards. When `IsBusy` display an intermediate progress bar
    at the top of the view instead of hiding the content and displaying a
    spinner.

commit da638b513589b3c4e2a1642b6e0962a31ccfb0e2
Author: Steven Kirk <grokys@gmail.com>
Date:   Tue Mar 7 16:08:04 2017 +0100

    Added IHasDone and IHasCancel interfaces.
    
    Refactor the `Done` and `Cancel` signals from `IDialogView` into
    `IHasDone` and `IHasCancel` interfaces so that views can define their
    capabilities in a more granular fashion. This has the slightly
    unfortunate side-effect of leaving `IDialogView` with only a single
    `IsBusy` signal which can't be refactored out into an interface because
    we already have an incompatible `IHasBusy` which is implemented by the
    view models. This will be resolved in the next step of refactoring where
    the signals are moved from the views to the view models.

Author: Steven Kirk <grokys@gmail.com>

    Compare IPullRequestModel by ref in setter.
    
    PullRequestModel overrides Equals such that two PRs with the same number are
    considered equal. This was causing the Model not to be updated on refresh: we need to use ReferenceEquals. Fixes #901

commit b37d84ac25847655515fcc3026d990215cc976a7
Author: Jamie Cansdale <jcansdale@gmail.com>
Date:   Tue Feb 28 14:35:09 2017 +0000

    Change `build.cmd` to build Experimental version
    
    The `Debug` configuration will be build with AllUsers=false and
    Experimental=true. This configuration can be installed without needing
    to uninstall the `AllUsers` version.
    Changed .cmd so that it works without the private `script` repo.

commit 6a96995b6189c411bb37da0565ace78abcc1d727
Author: Jamie Cansdale <jcansdale@gmail.com>
Date:   Mon Feb 27 16:08:07 2017 +0000

    Update Release configuration to have AllUsers=true
    
    By default the VSIX will be created with `AllUsers=false` and
    `Experimental=true`. It will be tweaked to have `AllUsers=true` and
    `Experimental=false` for the `Release` configuration.

commit 9e1936b7ec5fe46309dd340dc5a4dc1d60ac4426
Author: Jamie Cansdale <jcansdale@gmail.com>
Date:   Mon Feb 27 13:17:07 2017 +0000

    Only tweak .vsixmanifest when creating .vsix
    
    Build was failing when CreateVsixContainer was False.

commit 785e89e098134ca233521ebc7da86f9c56579be9
Author: Jamie Cansdale <jcansdale@gmail.com>
Date:   Fri Feb 24 12:43:31 2017 +0000

    Add Target to make .vsixmanifest Experimental
    
    Add an MSBuild Target that will update `extension.vsixmanifest` to have
    AllUsers="false" and Experimental="true" on 'Debug' and 'Release'
    configurations. The 'Publish' configuration will keep AllUsers="true"
    and Experimental="false".

commit 1d87ff07bc29affda149ce1ac7e586a6e71db963
Author: Jamie Cansdale <jcansdale@gmail.com>
Date:   Thu Feb 23 20:32:09 2017 +0000

    Add update script to reinstall extension
    
    Updated script uses `vsixutil.exe` which is like a scriptable version
    of `vsixinstaller.exe`. Extension will be installed for all versions of
    Visual Studio. It will only be installed for one VS 2017 SKU
    (prioritizing Enterprise, Professional then Community).

commit ba1ebe1872dda98fa7c5888eab18212b73930095
Author: Jamie Cansdale <jcansdale@gmail.com>
Date:   Fri Feb 24 14:46:37 2017 +0000

    Use AssemblyResolverPackage for assembly resolving
    
    The assembly resolver is required when XAML resources are loaded before
    the assemblies they depend on. The package is loaded early using
    `ProvideAutoLoad` and the `NoSolution` or Git service UIContext.

Author: Steven Kirk <grokys@gmail.com>
Date:   Thu Feb 23 13:26:01 2017 +0100

    Renamed StartPageClone -> ReClone.
    
    The name was misleading: a normal clone can also be initiated from the
    start page, this flow is for re-cloning a previously cloned repository.

commit 4d35734f847dce34944645ecf698391ea382d88a
Author: Steven Kirk <grokys@gmail.com>
Date:   Thu Feb 23 11:23:05 2017 +0100

    In order to fix #800, we need to pass a progress object to `IGitActionsExt.CloneAsync`. This was not easy before as the call to `CloneAsync` was hidden in the Clone button command in RepositoryCloneService. This commit:
    
    - Stops the `RepositoryCloneViewModel` from doing the clone itself
    - Adds a `DialogService` to show the clone dialogs and return their results
    - Adds a "progress" parameter to `RepositoryCloneService.CloneRepository` and `IVSGitServices.Clone`
    - Makes the connect and start pages use the dialog service to show the dialog and then call the clone service
    
    This commit also fixes #849:
    
    - `RepositoryCloneService.CloneRepository` and `IVSGitServices.Clone` now return a task that doesn't complete until the clone is complete
    - Changes `GitHubConnectSection` to have a `Clone` command which disabled itself while the clone is in progress.

commit a140ebdb69407ed1df907f1c6de48ee46350f149
Author: Steven Kirk <grokys@gmail.com>
Date:   Thu Feb 16 19:34:29 2017 +0100

    Refactor Button styling.
    
    - Remove `GitHubButton` style - this was the default style for all our
    buttons, but wasn't used anywhere. It appears to be the default style in
    GHfW but doesn't fit with Visual Studio. By removing this default style,
    buttons in Team Explorer use the default button style - fixes #796.
    - Make `GitHubVsButton` the default style for buttons in the GitHub
    pane. We only currently have one button that's not a primary button
    ("Cancel" in the PR creation view) but it should be the default style
    for subsequent buttons there, so removed the style from that individual
    button and made it apply to all buttons.

commit f9f8c8600eeff5bd997bea0d72535b103cc04325
Author: Jamie Cansdale <jcansdale@gmail.com>
Date:   Fri Feb 3 18:46:29 2017 +0000

    Clarify what `TryOpenRepository` means
    Return the best guess as to whether the target repository has been opened.
    Only navigate to home if we think the repository opened successfully.
    `TryOpenRepository` will return true when a transient solution is successfully created (which should trigger opening of repository).
    If the solution's '.vs\<name>\*.suo' file can't be deleted (for whatever reason), it will still return true.

commit 0a1cfee1937b6fe4b618a3ae8800c257b913b6fd
Merge: b7d0d316a c5b282512
Author: Andreia Gaita <shana@users.noreply.github.com>
Date:   Fri Jan 13 10:59:44 2017 +0100

    Merge pull request #771 from github/fixes/770-gists-not-working
    
    Fix GitHubServiceProvider.GetService<T, Ret>()

commit c5b282512736f9e22bdc8694b3a0cd648753ee9d
Author: Steven Kirk <grokys@github.com>
Date:   Thu Jan 12 15:40:51 2017 -0800

    Fix GitHubServiceProvider.GetService<T, Ret>()
    
    GitHubServiceProvider.GetService<T, Ret>() was previously calling
    `TryGetService<T>` which had the effect of tying to cast the service got
    as `T` to  an instance of `T`, which due to the joys of COM services
    failed. This was breaking gists. Fixes #770.

commit 29daf21f7bbf9ce620ea341959d3196a7f192618
Author: Steven Kirk <grokys@gmail.com>
Date:   Tue Jan 10 18:44:08 2017 +0100

    Prevent race condition in PR details view.
    
    In release build, between checking out the branch for a PR from a fork and setting the branch remote, the `PullRequestDetailsViewModel` could call `pullRequestsService.RemoveUnusedRemotes` which would remove the added remote. Make sure that unused remotes aren't tidied up while a checkout is in progress.
    
    Fixes #766

    account repository list. Attempt to fix that here.

    - it seems like the wrong place to be refreshing the connection manager

commit 2de4b97148bca3f0ce2e8df0e02a444aed50a623
Author: Steven Kirk <grokys@gmail.com>
Date:   Tue Jan 3 18:41:24 2017 +0100

    Allow >1 PR detail in the history list.
    
    Previously, only a single PR detail could be added to the history list,
    as `CreateView` tried to recycle the any previous PR detail controller
    which is not correct because that PR detail could belong to a different
    PR. Now, `CreateView` does not add entries to the `reusableControllers`
    collection (previously called simply `controllers`), only
    `CreateOrReuseView` does so.

commit 23c94d148221a57e3075e0d8140c68d4d634ac21
Merge: 95489e1e6 76b5b7fa6
Author: Andreia Gaita <shana@users.noreply.github.com>
Date:   Tue Dec 20 19:32:54 2016 +0000

    Merge pull request #751 from github/fixes/fix-deadlock-on-init
    
    Fix race condition on initialization

commit 76b5b7fa6e38a98126a109e5b85fdce0789d7c4a
Author: Andreia Gaita <shana@spoiledcat.net>
Date:   Tue Dec 20 11:20:48 2016 -0800

    Fix race condition on initialization
    
    If the package loader happens very early at VS init time,
    the call to get the ComponentModel inside GitHubServiceProvider
    will take some time (while VS is pondering life), causing the
    Initialize codepath to continue attemping to initialize the menus,
    which will cause a reentrancy deadlock between MEF getting services.

    Use proportional text fontsizes for pull request title

commit bebac15e6ca2a5fa968b1612c50536ab3f189159
Author: Steven Kirk <grokys@gmail.com>
Date:   Mon Dec 12 21:36:35 2016 +0100

    Handle diff/open of non-checked out files.
    
    When viewing a PR from a fork in the PR details view, if the fork has
    not been fetched locally then "Compare File" and "Open File" were
    failing silently. This is because to get the files to compare, we looked
    up the PR HEAD commit and get the file from the returned tree. We did a
    fetch before looking up the PR HEAD but if the fork is a repository that
    does not yet have a remote then we won't have fetched the commit.
    
    This adds a fallback to using the API and storing a cached version of
    the file contents.

commit 36549d08fcf53634834b9e3d48ed7c8b9d2757d3
Author: Steven Kirk <grokys@gmail.com>
Date:   Thu Dec 8 20:14:16 2016 +0100

    Clean up unused remotes.
    
    When checking out a PR branch from a fork, we create a named remote.
    This means that we'll slow accumulate unused remotes over time, which
    isn't ideal.
    
    This commit:
    
    - Adds a config key to identify remotes created by us
    - Removes unused remotes created by us each time a PR details page is
    shown

    Refactored PR from fork handling.
    
    We now set up the local branch to track the branch from the fork, so
    that pushing and pulling from a fork behaves identically to pushing and
    pulling from a local branch, as long as the PR submitter has enabled the
    option to write to the PR branch.

commit a26703d584836b0816dc2bb9f94a754d3952969a
Author: Steven Kirk <grokys@gmail.com>
Date:   Wed Nov 9 19:58:15 2016 +0100

    Don't use RxUI for Repositories binding.
    
    As it was sometimes setting the selection on the `ListBox` without user
    interaction. Instead, use XAML bindings. Unfortunately this required
    binding to a dependency property on the view itself. Better solutions
    moving forward would be:
    
    - Declare the collection view in XAML. This would require the Group
    classes to be made public, but they have a dependency on state in the
    view.
    - Declate the collection view in the view model.
    
    I didn't implement either of these solutions as I felt the changes would
    be too impactful on the codebase at this point in time.

commit c9b990fa9104808c0769b978a4c9001fbb1e3dfa
Author: Steven Kirk <grokys@gmail.com>
Date:   Wed Nov 9 19:22:14 2016 +0100

    Bump version to 2.0.99.2

commit 0db5532962e3e10af5091a33c81dee1e21f6a751
Author: Steven Kirk <grokys@gmail.com>
Date:   Wed Nov 9 17:48:39 2016 +0100

    Switch to main thread on repository creation.
    
    Before checking out created repository, this is needed because
    `vsGitServices.Clone` ends up calling into `AsyncPackage.GetService`
    which cannot be called from a background thread.

commit 25ec1714e6bdc5562c04b8a1f5f05dc6982c650a
Author: Steven Kirk <grokys@gmail.com>
Date:   Tue Nov 8 20:51:17 2016 +0100

    Fix LinkDropDown.
    
    To allow it to work with data templates. This removes the previous hack
    in `UpdateLinkText` and adds a `LinkItemTemplate` property that can be
    used to supply a data template with which to display the selected item.
    
    Also had to modify `BranchNameConverter` slightly to accept plain
    strings as input as when the `LinkDropDown` is using the `Header`
    property as its `LinkItem` this will get passed through the converter
    too.

commit 6d642a4ba1ffa9c949d0131267eed21e8d25e341
Author: Andreia Gaita <shana@spoiledcat.net>
Date:   Wed Oct 19 14:38:36 2016 +0200

    Switch to nuget for all VS references
    
    We need to build against versions of VS assemblies that match the
    earliest VS version we support, and build machines might not have all VS
    versions installed, so we switch to nuget to guarantee that we always
    compile against the same set of assemblies.

commit a3e97dc4b90554db75e6e783dd5ee60bad483e7c
Author: Andreia Gaita <shana@spoiledcat.net>
Date:   Tue Aug 30 17:07:23 2016 +0200

    Load the package asynchronously
    
    To load things async, nothing in the loading path can call GetService or
    GetGlobalService, since these will deadlock. This requires moving a bunch
    of initialization code out of constructors, so things can be initialized
    on request and after the package load codepath is done.

commit 31eb90297d7004f284284dea00b953f2ef7a2068
Author: Steven Kirk <grokys@gmail.com>
Date:   Tue Sep 6 13:08:10 2016 +0200

    Renamed repository model classes/interfaces.
    
    - IRepositoryModelBase -> IRepositoryModel
    - SimpleRepositoryModel -> LocalRepositoryModel
    - RepositoryModel -> RemoteRepositoryModel

commit 8ad7b77f7c46f8a06ec57d18b3ee340582c773f5
Author: Steven Kirk <grokys@gmail.com>
Date:   Tue Sep 6 13:02:56 2016 +0200

    Change repository model class hierarchy.
    
    In preparation for the following rename:
    
    - SimpleRepositoryModel -> LocalRepositoryModel
    - RepositoryModel -> RemoteRepositoryModel
    
    Change the repository model hierarchy to make RepositoryModel and
    SimpleRepositoryModel inherit from a common base rather than
    RepositoryModel from SimpleRepositoryModel. This means that information
    that is not relevant to a remote repository (local path etc) is no
    longer present on RepositoryModel.

commit 9bce8cc6b2f146e562199a1d10fccfe9e0cdc84e
Author: Andreia Gaita <shana@spoiledcat.net>
Date:   Wed Aug 17 21:24:22 2016 +0200

    Make sure we dispose in the right order
    
    Disposing of everything in the TrackingCollection in one go is
    potentially going to cause the signal objects to be disposed before the
    pumps are. Since pumps rely on the signal objects, this can cause
    disposed exceptions.

commit 98ee6e909eae5f0e47f0dbbc65af7d7d166e4899
Merge: 544268718 507da9fd2
Author: Andreia Gaita <shana@spoiledcat.net>
Date:   Thu Jul 14 11:24:20 2016 -0700

    Merge branch 'master' into issues/409-scrollviewer-fix

commit 54426871895c12576c0ab1b6dbadf9abd445d1fb
Author: Steven Kirk <grokys@github.com>
Date:   Thu Jul 14 10:23:29 2016 -0700

    Fix ScrollViewer
    
    ScrollViewer is broken - it doesn't pass mouse wheel events to parent
    even when there's nothing to scroll. Work around it by manually passing
    the event to the parent. See
    https://serialseb.blogspot.com/2007/09/wpf-tips-6-preventing-scrollviewer-from.html
    for more info. Fixes #409 .

commit 6d8f9e15a838a9c314a59d6b645fad55742d48eb
Author: Steven Kirk <grokys@gmail.com>
Date:   Thu Jul 7 12:28:47 2016 +0200

    Prevent filter being set twice.
    
    Setting the Author/Assignee filter to [None] should not trigger a filter
    in the view model: doing this will remove the [None] entry from Authors,
    which will cause the selection in the view to be set to null which will
    reset the filter.

commit a863cf207f2dee306566f5a8ea13d0c6cf2686f5
Author: Steven Kirk <grokys@github.com>
Date:   Fri Jun 24 07:25:49 2016 +0200

    Make IO operations go through Funcs
    
    This is the same pattern used by `ConnectionManager` which allows us to
    pass in mocked rothko interfaces for testing, but ensure that the rothko
    dependency isn't loaded at runtime. However in GitHub.Exports we don't
    have and (possibly) don't want a dependency on rothko so we need to work
    out what to do there.

    Fix T4 in VS
    
    T4 gets very confused if there's another file with the same as the generated file, and it will output a different filename as a result, causing conflicts. Make the generated file have a different name so it doesn't get confused.

commit b5e4c22bd3ac1adc966e9d090c4091d5706b04a4
Author: Steven Kirk <grokys@github.com>
Date:   Thu Jun 23 16:55:41 2016 +0200

    Don't store UsageModel in memory.

    possibility of race conditions here but as they would be unlikely and
    the impact would be minimal, I'm tempted to just accept the possibility
    rather than make the code more complex.

commit 47002f5f80c6014e90c4ae76e0059f7b72050e0b
Author: Steven Kirk <grokys@gmail.com>
Date:   Mon May 30 14:12:21 2016 +0200

    Removed DefaultRepositoryName
    
    From `IRepositoryPublishViewModel`. Seems to not be needed and was
    causing #279.
    
    The default repository name was being placed directly into
    `RepositoryPublishControl.nameText` in the control which meant:
    
    - it was only written to `RepositoryName` when the user clicked on the
    `nameText` control
    - which meant that `RepositoryName` was up until that point null
    - which meant that the validation for it was failing
    - which meant the "Publish" button was disabled.
    
    This commit just sets the `RepositoryName` to the default in the VM ctor
    meaning that that name gets immediately validated.
    `DefaultRepositoryName` didn't seem to be used anywhere else, so I
    removed it.
    
    cc: @Haacked for a sanity check because it looks like you wrote this.
    
    Fixes #279

commit e37842f53f7f479ce9ec5e15a63bb8ef30ec717e

commit 36586863a54a2dcdc2b9cb7ecd7f87e9bf43507f
Author: Steven Kirk <grokys@gmail.com>
Date:   Wed May 25 12:13:56 2016 +0200

    Don't use AccountCacheItem on login failure.
    
    Previously, if an exception occurred while logging in to an account that
    has previously been logged in, then an AccountCacheItem was read from
    the cache and that was used. This meant we couldn't check the response's
    scopes for gist support.

commit 3c5cb88225383517ce5b8a482ac17b3056066ccf
Merge: 7a6586fbf 00beae947
Author: Andreia Gaita <shana@spoiledcat.net>

commit 427f206f494d925e41acd1d99654694c0d4d759c
Author: Steven Kirk <grokys@gmail.com>
Date:   Fri May 20 10:09:30 2016 +0100

    Use Merge instead of Amb on login control.
    
    Fixes #309. `Observable.Amb` "emits all of the items from only the first
    of these Observables to emit an item or notification". This means that
    if the user tries to login first to .com with an invalid login, then
    tries to login to enterprise with a valid login the login from
    enterprise will be ignored because the .com observable fired first.
    Instead use `Observable.Merge` which will emit authentication results
    from both in any order.

commit 7a6586fbf1c7d73416a7a0aa8240db02495321de
Merge: da9b7623e d7b2353f4
Author: Andreia Gaita <shana@spoiledcat.net>
Date:   Thu May 19 16:54:47 2016 -0500

commit d7b2353f4cdc3df98fe428e532bba4bc632db1ac
Author: Steven Kirk <grokys@gmail.com>
Date:   Thu May 19 11:05:30 2016 +0100

    Don't call cancel.OnCompleted after disposal.
    
    `cancel.OnNext` causes `cancel` to get disposed, so don't try calling
    `OnCompleted` on it afterwards. Fixes #311.

commit 0faf0b9d93755c64a7754210db6e0de9af5e9d4b
Author: Steven Kirk <grokys@gmail.com>
Date:   Fri May 13 11:57:09 2016 +0200

    Correctly read scopes for basic auth.
    
    Connections with basic auth don't include the `X-OAuth-Scopes` header -
    the scopes must be read from `Authorization.GetAll().Scopes`.

commit ceca36bd0ae7f2954b18239d51ec7c230543b90d
Author: Steven Kirk <grokys@github.com>
Date:   Wed May 4 16:31:31 2016 -0700

    Initial support for collapsing in clone dialog.
    
    Makes groups in the clone dialog collapsible. If there is only a single
    group, then it will be expanded; as more groups are created, the first
    group is collapsed and further groups will be added collapsed.
    
    Only problem with this is that you can see an initial flash of expanded
    items when loading with multiple groups, however I felt this was
    preferable to everything being collapsed until the whole list is
    loaded...

    to ShowValidateError is.

commit b91c7b556367bddc0cc386797a1704693363cf97
Author: Don Okuda <don.okuda@gmail.com>
Date:   Wed May 4 11:13:03 2016 -0700

    Move PromptTextBox styles and don't hardcode height

commit b24b202570b4b07f254f2845a7fdca18098784a1
Author: Andreia Gaita <shana@spoiledcat.net>
Date:   Tue May 3 16:57:34 2016 -0700

    Make sure github pane is reentrant
    
    Fixes #282
    
    We were getting into a state when loading the pane for the first time
    where `Reload` would be called once as a result of the `RepoChanged`
    call, which triggers when `Initialize(ServiceProvider)` runs, and then
    `Reload` would run again as a result of the `Initialize(ViewWithData)`
    call, because the Pull Requests button was clicked, which causes the
    pane to reset itself. These two `Reload` calls would be executing
    concurrently, causing a race condition that would crash randomly if the
    controller was stopped and restarted at just the right point.
    
    Need to make sure that nothing else can happen while
    `Initialize(ServiceProvider)` is running, and that
    `Initialize(ServiceProvider)` is run serially (no asyncs here!).

commit 206de9a9c9bc44beaca74e1df75d04711de2815a
Author: Andreia Gaita <shana@spoiledcat.net>

commit e7dc701604f9ea5f04f72b399bc3fe8c846c505a
Merge: 400978285 98d550364
Author: Phil Haack <haacked@gmail.com>
Date:   Tue May 3 11:13:05 2016 -0700

    Merge pull request #280 from github/fixes/fix-horrible-cache-leak
    
    Fix premature cache disposal

commit 98d550364153f6a260220bae95249bae17d3b14f
Author: Andreia Gaita <shana@spoiledcat.net>
Date:   Mon May 2 17:43:18 2016 -0700

    Fix premature cache disposal
    
    Now that we're not creating a million copies of the same cache every
    time something wants something for the cache, `ModelService` can't just
    willy-nilly dispose of the `hostCache` object when it feels like it,
    because that cache object is in itself cached in the factory and will be
    reused by other services, if needed.
    
    The factory is the one responsible for keeping the lifetime of its
    cached objects (and yes, now it should probably not be called a factory
    anymore, it should be a service but oh well), and so now it needs to be
    disposable and take care of things.

commit 8e14765a964adf572b67ae5d1b64007561df4f4d
Author: Andreia Gaita <shana@spoiledcat.net>
Date:   Fri Apr 29 17:02:11 2016 -0700

    Fix all the bindings
    
    A bunch of classes were doing xaml bindings in a very wrong way, relying
    on some external code setting the ViewModel property explicitly and not
    defining the bindings in xaml.
    Make every SimpleUserControl subclass set the ViewModel property via the
    DataContextChanged event (DataContext is set for every view in
    UIController), and fix the xaml bindings so things work.
    Remove useless ReactiveUI code-behind bindings while we're at it, it's
    pointless doing it twice.
    
    This should fix #274 and #275

commit 88d1d2dd08f0d6b0925d84a96dd5d4f163e36d14
Author: Don Okuda <don.okuda@gmail.com>
Date:   Thu Apr 28 11:44:32 2016 -0700

    Support themes!

commit 1f2e8dd82617e27ce10aee0c79b8e96615afc29d
Author: Don Okuda <don.okuda@gmail.com>
Date:   Thu Apr 28 11:06:16 2016 -0700

    Explain myself

commit e5a67ebcd77fe75102814168da051d02a990e610
Author: Andreia Gaita <shana@spoiledcat.net>
Date:   Thu Apr 28 19:54:20 2016 +0200

    Make sure our assembly resolver always runs
    
    Fixes #267
    
    For some reason, the xaml loader fails miserably when trying to resolve
    where to load our DLLs from if they're not yet in the process. The
    directories it's scanning don't include the extension installation path,
    so it can't find any assemblies that are referenced directly from xaml
    (using types from other assemblies in code works fine, using them in
    xaml doesn't).
    We have an assembly resolver code path as part of our ResourceDictionary
    implementation (SharedDictionaryManager), so every xaml user control
    needs to have at least one include that uses SharedDictionaryManager in
    order to trigger the assembly resolver hook up and ensure that libraries
    are found.

commit 86aaa374ae6664397721db7818e8f788a7eb15b3

    Add navigation support and change initialization logic

commit a3447e24cd48ac6819057122a7410773a8568349
Author: Andreia Gaita <shana@spoiledcat.net>
Date:   Fri Apr 22 17:43:38 2016 +0200

    Avoid a stack overflow on ICommand executions
    
    The implementation for OleMenuCommand apparently doesn't protect against
    reentrant calls of the canEnable callbacks (same bug ReactiveUI has, but
    at least there the class is private...). When executing a command, if
    the execution triggers a xaml refresh, it will call canEnable, re-enable
    the buttons, then execute all over again! As expected, this doesn't work
    well...
    
    CanEnable callbacks need to return false until the execution is fully
    done.

commit 6819bea863958a6d2a9a2841243c9d6c8e6f02ed
Author: Andreia Gaita <shana@spoiledcat.net>
Date:   Fri Apr 22 17:40:09 2016 +0200

    Implement filtering of the pr list view

commit 9f0f2d1ef5502f7021922a8f9b8a8ab35852704a
Author: Andreia Gaita <shana@spoiledcat.net>
Date:   Fri Apr 22 17:38:28 2016 +0200

    We totally don't need this any more

commit 4827ba63beec9e4b48758720960834029b46f665
Author: Andreia Gaita <shana@spoiledcat.net>
Date:   Fri Apr 22 17:37:49 2016 +0200

    Make TrackingCollection refreshable

commit a75f2e2bd85fb59d864538aea4103b2cfe2d7a1b
Author: Andreia Gaita <shana@spoiledcat.net>
Date:   Fri Apr 22 17:37:07 2016 +0200

    Add a xaml behavior and converter to support [None] items on top of lists
    
    For lists where we want to support having no selection, it's handy to
    have an "empty" item on top of the list for the user to select. The
    behavior added here will add such an item to the top of a list if the
    selected property has a value set in it. If the selected property is
    null, the behavior removes the "empty" item.
    
    The behavior requires that the `ItemsSource` binding of the ItemsControl
    it's attached to be a MultiBinding, where the first entry is the bound
    property that contains the "empty" item to show.
    
    The `StickieListItemConverter` makes sure that the ItemsSource gets set
    with the second entry of the MultiBinding.

commit a65a58715a99bfd6ec08e6236dbb557aa9f69853
Author: Andreia Gaita <shana@spoiledcat.net>
Date:   Fri Apr 22 17:30:30 2016 +0200

    Add support for refreshing an existing collection
    
    To support refreshing data from the server without having to clear the
    whole collection and redo inserting and sorting and filtering all over
    again, we can just pass an existing collection to `ModelService`, so it
    will set up the new query and update the existing collection.

commit e726e6ad237c378493d79208e0e4edbee9469b18
Author: Andreia Gaita <shana@spoiledcat.net>
Date:   Fri Apr 22 17:27:52 2016 +0200

    Make IAccount usable in TrackingCollection
    
    Types used in `ITrackingCollection` need to implement `ICopyable`,
    `IEquatable` and `IComparable`, so they can be sorted and replaced in
    the collection.

commit 9850b9eabd2c72effd35cda1dff6704a46d46426
Author: Andreia Gaita <shana@spoiledcat.net>
Date:   Fri Apr 22 17:21:59 2016 +0200

    Make DataContext a part of the IView
    
    We need to set the ViewModel via DataContext, otherwise WPF won't
    trigger binding events, so make DataContext a part of the IView, and
    make sure ViewModel is not readonly.
    Also, make ViewModel typed, no reason for it to be object.

commit 7cc8603f3c2f4e862a726c58213b5c241b666a1f
Merge: c55940522 80c405e81
Author: Andreia Gaita <shana@spoiledcat.net>
Date:   Fri Apr 22 16:46:18 2016 +0200

    Merge fixes/fix-horrible-cache-leak into feature/pr/views

commit 80c405e81d50da778190cf659933d241e080a95c
Author: Andreia Gaita <shana@spoiledcat.net>
Date:   Fri Apr 22 16:41:02 2016 +0200

    Cache blob caches
    
    SQLitePersistentBlobCache need to be cached, `ImageCache` creates
    a new one every time it needs to load an image from the cache, and
    they persist across the lifetime of the application, resulting in
    a million tasks just hanging there waiting for work, eventually
    exhausting system resources.

commit 2fb5f32d51cc8493f0ecda808bcc2da17fe8a66c
Author: Andreia Gaita <shana@spoiledcat.net>

commit 5d05e4f9d9c8edd3c3402e34dd4edac5804a895c
Author: Andreia Gaita <shana@spoiledcat.net>
Date:   Mon Mar 28 15:02:16 2016 -0700

    Remove unneeded code

commit a2d7a2bdbdb1142d6b211ff9c609a35517ce8fb9
Author: Andreia Gaita <shana@spoiledcat.net>
Date:   Mon Mar 28 15:00:51 2016 -0700

    Make sure only one instance of a service is created
    
    IVSServices and ITeamExplorerServices have methods that depend on types
    from specific versions of TeamFoundation. Unfortunately, because the
    class itself doesn't depend on any TeamFoundation types, it can be
    happily instantiated by the runtime, which means that there would be two
    instances of each of these MEF exports floating around, which of course
    silently crashes the MEF loading of any other types that depend on these
    services in their constructors.
    
    We need to make sure that any service exported by these
    TeamFoundation-specific projects have fields/properties/constructors
    that depend on TeamFoundation types, so that they will not be
    instantiated if the VS they're running on is a different version.

commit 4be2364f3b9ff1f1fa30f5b7cd5ff1462f0f4cbf
Author: Andreia Gaita <shana@spoiledcat.net>
Date:   Mon Mar 28 10:25:14 2016 -0700

    Bump script

    Add theming
    
    Any xaml file that includes a SharedDictionaryManager resource
    dictionary with the uri "Theme.xaml" will get a themed dictionary
    included instead that tracks the VS theme and gets switched at runtime
    whenever the VS theme changes.

commit 95ef4f238f3dfb7ed55cde993b4e485ca144a837

    Make sure we never blow up in release mode

    run tests in debug and release mode in the buildbot so we're sure we
    catch all the problems.

commit 29678146382c1c5e05d776dd15f88eb5bbe28ea8
Author: Andreia Gaita <shana@spoiledcat.net>
Date:   Thu Jan 21 16:01:44 2016 +0100

    Bump version to 1.0.17.0

commit 471b6cb968dc36e1b6444a305c87ae3f665ae97d
Author: Andreia Gaita <shana@spoiledcat.net>
Date:   Thu Jan 21 01:52:01 2016 +0100

    Fix race condition when finishing ui flows
    
    Let's decide that the `IUIController.ListenToCompletionState` observable
    finishes first, and then the `IUIController.SelectFlow` observable. Once
    the `SelectFlow` observable is completed, it's a fair bet that the
    `IUIController` is disposed and it isn't safe to access it for anything
    else.
    
    Fixes #203 properly

commit 2376acee547f3095d1e408a8561edab4301c57a8
Author: Andreia Gaita <shana@spoiledcat.net>
Date:   Wed Jan 20 21:19:01 2016 +0100

    Listen to all relevant notifications
    
    There's two types of notifications that can come up via the Publish
    viewmodel: warnings from validators while filling out the form, and
    errors from the publish process. Errors are sent via the notification
    system, and warnings come up via the validators.
    
    We're doing it like this for now because warnings are reactive based on
    user input (so they go away if the validator becomes valid), and I'm
    still not sure if the NotificationDispatcher should have a
    `ClearNotifications` method (it's just dispatching messages, is it its
    job to invalidate messages too? unsure)

commit bfb2cd30267b57d5d35371e9b200dd370c0900f0
Author: Andreia Gaita <shana@spoiledcat.net>
Date:   Wed Jan 20 21:14:09 2016 +0100

Date:   Mon Jan 18 01:52:50 2016 -0500

    Allow the Account property to return null.
    
    Because we get the account asynchronously, it can be null when we try to Bind it to the Gist popup which causes a fody nullguard assertion error.

    Fix login credential persistence

commit 1083f00042ae49349b6583b2b38c5b3a254c17c5
Author: Andreia Gaita <shana@spoiledcat.net>
Date:   Fri Jan 15 14:58:29 2016 +0100

    ViewModels only notify if there are errors
    
    If operations are successful, we know from the result of the command, so
    ViewModels only call the notification service in case of errors (so we
    can grab the message). Also, they shouldn't be hooking directly into the
    VS UI, that's for the view to handle (or whoever is controlling the
    view, if the view is embedded and the error needs to be shown somewhere
    else)
    
    Fix tests so that they look for the correct events when things change
    and not rely on the notification service for anything other than errors.

commit 023e534e77f6bc6c1c727d4712f37cc521e70048
Author: Andreia Gaita <shana@spoiledcat.net>
Date:   Fri Jan 15 14:56:00 2016 +0100

    Better way to handle notifications

commit 3765f643bf822b6a5120a53e5b3b4557f1017e52
Author: Andreia Gaita <shana@spoiledcat.net>
Date:   Fri Jan 15 14:09:37 2016 +0100

    No blowing up, show error instead

commit 7ef3a1f61c9da2f55cda2a47790d0f6c465145f0

commit 3cebf10424b45ca9d973467a37f41556b0dd4584
Author: Andreia Gaita <shana@spoiledcat.net>
Date:   Tue Jan 12 18:54:10 2016 +0100

    Fix race condition
    
    The `ListenToCompletionState` subscription was triggering a navigation
    request on the `Next` callback. Depending on how fast VS responds, this
    can cause the Sync section to be disposed, along with the `UIController`
    instance, before the handler returns, which would cause `UIController`
    to crash.
    
    Make sure we only navigate away once the `ListenToCompletionState`
    observable is completed, and also tweak the way `Dispose` happens in
    `UIController` to minimize races.

commit 0ed650c23541e6877921e80234531387e49581f9
Author: Andreia Gaita <shana@spoiledcat.net>
Date:   Tue Jan 12 18:04:21 2016 +0100

    Clean up commented code

Author: Andreia Gaita <shana@spoiledcat.net>
Date:   Tue Jan 12 17:00:26 2016 +0100

    Fix test

commit 90473bfd762f97c156c07f5af49f6e7413ea98e0
Author: Andreia Gaita <shana@spoiledcat.net>
Date:   Tue Jan 12 16:53:19 2016 +0100

    Fix a delay in loading the connect page
    
    Querying the registry for repositories is visibly delaying the UI, which
    is a no-no! Fixicate.

commit 0cef013028e39d27000637e8241aac9a416f999e
Author: Andreia Gaita <shana@spoiledcat.net>
Date:   Tue Jan 12 16:48:46 2016 +0100

    Make sure an IConnection is always registered
    
    Fix a bug where if we're logged in but don't pass a connection to Start,
    no connection object would be passed along to whatever viewmodel we're
    loading, which is a Bad Thing(tm).
    
    If we're logged in but no connection object is passed in, we should
    retrieve the first available logged-in connection from the connections
    list and pass that one in, so that viewmodels *always* get a connection.

commit c27a37436d091ba48ee3b7acc19d8c6c5468b44d
Author: Andreia Gaita <shana@spoiledcat.net>
Date:   Wed Dec 9 00:48:22 2015 +0100

    Make sure publish form goes away when it's done
    
    We now track completion state of the publish repo process
    so that we can fire Done() only when it's actually done...
    otherwise the observable subscriptions waiting for things
    to be done will get disposed after the first publish attempt,
    and if that fails, well, subscriptions are completed and disposed
    so the form stops reacting to anything else.

commit 9fca5af9a4f02662cb0fb06d62e78fe54d23b1fe

commit 623b5ab194fbabfa37b7eb949841a84244276919
Author: Andreia Gaita <shana@spoiledcat.net>
Date:   Thu Nov 12 18:49:18 2015 +0100

    Fix showing auth dialogs for long-running ui flows
    
    We already support showing a separate dialog for authentication, but it
    only worked when the selected ui flow was either authentication or the
    clone/create flows, which reuse the same dialog window. It also worked
    for publish, but that one is actually cheating by running two separate
    ui flows (the auth and then the publish)
    
    Since we now support long running ui flows that switch to subflows when
    needed, we need to be able to show a view in either the pane or in the
    dialog, basically popping up the dialog whenever needed and then
    shutting it down without stopping the ui flow.

commit 88fc6dc31049a799c167f9b5ab4ce255b8f9d6b2
Author: Andreia Gaita <shana@spoiledcat.net>
Date:   Mon Nov 9 14:58:08 2015 +0100

    Make sure we reset state properly after cloning/creating

commit edddce9062c3d239b83a0cda8c10a5319b0ab0d2
Author: Andreia Gaita <shana@spoiledcat.net>
Date:   Mon Nov 9 14:50:12 2015 +0100

    Allow replacing the IConnection service registration
    
    For concurrent ui flows, we register the connection of the current flow
    which is immediately picked up by the viewmodel. Another ui flow might
    run and register a connection to be picked up by its viewmodel, and by
    the time the first ui flow is done and tries to remove the iconnection
    registration, that iconnection is not the one it registered any more. So
    we're not removing registrations any more, and we just let the
    UIController replace the IConnection any time it needs to launch a new
    viewmodel.

commit 0ee808cd9cac2df89fe65b195b3335d23353c9d9
Author: Andreia Gaita <shana@spoiledcat.net>
Date:   Wed Oct 28 11:48:15 2015 +0100

    Do not mix reference and value checks
    
    In equality methods and operators, I prefer not to mix reference and
    value checks in one line. These are different checks and the value parts
    may change in the future. These are very easy to get wrong, so I prefer
    to keep them as readable and split up as possible.

commit d4d6175f38adde9edba730e0032a4950472a4cb8

Date:   Wed Oct 28 11:37:20 2015 +0100

    Otherwise the IsInUnitTests flag won't be set and we'll get into trouble.

commit 01f17b552d5e61c7751487f560eb9c431a52192d
Author: Andreia Gaita <shana@spoiledcat.net>
Date:   Tue Oct 6 14:03:14 2015 +0200

    A cache index for akavache objects
    
    CacheIndex stores a list of string keys of all the objects that are a
    part of a query - all pull requests for a repository (regardless of
    state); all repositories for a user, etc. When a query is performed
    (GetPullRequests for instance), the CacheIndex object is obtained from
    akavache and all the objects referenced by the index keys are returned.
    If it needs to be refreshed, the fetch function is called and each
    returned object will be added/refreshed in akavache and the index will
    also be updated.
    
    This way, no matter what type of filtering is performed on the query,
    only one object of each type will be saved (keys are in the form
    `user|repo|objecttype|id`), and we can leverage the fact that GitHub
    list apis return full objects and not trimmed-down indexes, avoiding
    doing the same query twice (once for list, once for detail), since the
    object will be fully cached during listing and immediately available for
    detail.
    
    We will want to use sql queries directly at some point, for searches and
    other more advanced uses, but for now this works. We can use these index
    objects to create real sql indexes later on.

commit 4e57dd24ff666817003f4542f74a81b48aca7406
Merge: 5bc3aa1a8 7d40d7415
Author: Andreia Gaita <shana@spoiledcat.net>
Date:   Tue Oct 6 16:43:06 2015 +0200

    Merge feature/pr/tracking-list into feature/pr/streaming-cache

commit 7d40d7415dfd91f64d049e375c08f791b0fb08d4
Author: Andreia Gaita <shana@spoiledcat.net>
Date:   Tue Oct 6 00:40:20 2015 +0200

    Collection that tracks observable sequences
    
    TrackingCollection gets items from an observable sequence and updates
    its contents in such a way that two updates to the same object (as
    defined by an Equals call) will result in one object on the list being
    updated (as opposed to having two different instances of the object
    added to the list).
    
    This allows us to grab a bunch of objects from cache, load a collection
    with them, and then request updated versions of the objects from the
    server, which when returned will update the collection in place (and the
    UI with it), seamlessly.
    
    The collection supports ordering and filtering, and filtering includes
    enough information to allow limiting the number of items to return (and
    display). It can be resorted and refiltered in place.

commit 2ed22d571d0a547beb97a423ebbe4d223e97f380
Author: Andreia Gaita <shana@spoiledcat.net>
Date:   Tue Oct 6 12:38:33 2015 +0200

    GitHub Pane view and viewmodel
    
    Add a view and viewmodel for the GitHubPane. They'll handle hosting the
    views for specific features (pull request list, pull request creation,
    detail, etc), as well as loading and navigating between them, using a
    long-lived instance of UIController. Toolbar commands are controlled by
    the view model.
    
    The view model gets informed of contextual repository changes in the
    same way that sections and navigation items do - by hooking up to
    TeamExplorerServiceHolder (via the constructor) and getting
    notifications. These notifications are now also sent via property
    events, as well as `RepoChanged()` calls.

commit d99b34ac4e1a20aabbdb002e571e0484729a68ee
Author: Andreia Gaita <shana@spoiledcat.net>
Date:   Wed Sep 23 15:12:21 2015 +0200

    Fix IGitService
    
    Make static methods that mirror the IGitService instance methods and use
    either a real mef instance or a fake one to get at the instance methods.
    
    Things are slightly broken getting a reference to IGitService - in real
    life, it's not a service, it's an exported value, but in unit tests it's
    treated as a service (because this stupid distinction between services
    and exported values is stupid).
    
    So, IGitService is nothing but a bunch of helper methods, and we want to
    use it as an instance and not just static methods, so that we can bypass
    hitting the filesystem and libgit2# methods in unit tests. Some bits
    that need IGitService for realz are running in places where there's no
    MEF.
    
    Therefore, the only time where it really makes a difference when/how the
    IGitService instance is created is in unit tests. When running for real,
    it makes zero difference if the instance is coming from mef or if it's
    just created on the spot, so that's what we're doing now.

commit 6fd69fd0e3dc89e36073e5fb27bcebb5feeffd84
Author: Andreia Gaita <shana@spoiledcat.net>
Date:   Fri Sep 18 16:20:13 2015 +0200

    Add support for testing code that uses LibGit2Sharp
    
    Testing RepositoryModel creation via the path constructor implies
    hitting libgit2sharp codepaths, and libgit2sharp doesn't expose nice
    interfaces for testing (why??). So, move things around and add a
    GitService that replaces the extension methods that depend on
    libgit2sharp, so we can at least mock at a higher level.
    
    The things that require this GitService are not created via mef, so
    expose it via the Services static class.

Author: Andreia Gaita <shana@spoiledcat.net>
Date:   Wed Sep 9 16:59:43 2015 +0200

    Improve detection of content to show the open dialog
    
    Having commits is not enough to decide whether to show the create or the
    open dialog. Check whether the repo has subdirectories or files that are
    not a readme and don't start with .. That at least should be a hint that
    there's something to open in it.

commit 53abd609598585ea4d30804b07790ad49b26184a
Author: Andreia Gaita <shana@spoiledcat.net>
Date:   Wed Sep 9 14:50:39 2015 +0200

    Show custom notifications for cloned repos too
    
    Now both creating and cloning show messages with the url of the
    repository, plus a link to create or open a project/solution, depending
    on the situation.
    If it's a created repo, link to the Create dialog.
    If it's a cloned repo that doesn't have commits, link to the Create
    dialog.
    If it's a cloned repo that has commits, link to the Open dialog.

commit 4bdd3f991c62730ce8984011185f82f6b86e05f3
Author: Andreia Gaita <shana@spoiledcat.net>
Date:   Wed Sep 9 13:27:40 2015 +0200

    Fix reacting to new repos on the list
    
    If the user is logged out and clicks Create or Clone, they'll go through
    the login dialog and the repository list will get populated as soon as
    that's done, before the actual create/clone action starts. We don't want
    to handle those "new" repos on the list as if they've just been
    cloned/created.

    with the existing cache files and we don't really need to cache it right
    now. Let's see how it works just loading directly from the registry for
    now.

    use it :)

commit c5ac2316d24893c117d60594fb39ed7bf097c4b4
Author: Haacked <haacked@gmail.com>
Date:   Wed Aug 5 16:37:43 2015 -0700

    Avoid potential race condition
    
    In theory, if "ClearFormCache" is called after we check `contains` but
    before we execute the `return` line, we could get an exception here.
    
    If we're concerned about performance here, we could consider switching
    to the ConcurrentDictionary.

    repositories (such as GitHub Enterprise instances). Many of them are not
    set up with HTTPS because they're behind a firewall etc.

    Add method for appending relative paths to urls

    different results if the url ends with "/" or not. So we need to make
    absolutely sure it _does_ end with "/".

commit c1c715d141772cae5f75be62f52cb5d96a361f48
Author: Andreia Gaita <shana@spoiledcat.net>
Date:   Thu Jun 18 00:30:49 2015 +0200

    Kinda big refactor of the home and nav item loading
    
    TeamServiceHolder now handles getting repository changed events and
    notifies all classes that need to be informed of repository state
    (sections and nav items). Repository data is cached the first time its
    loaded and persists until VS shuts down, for all repos that are opened.
    
    Also fix colors of nav items in the dark theme
