commit e0fd5a75b267211fd5d430919ea103737706d24a
Author: Andreia Gaita <shana@spoiledcat.net>
Date:   Fri Jun 12 12:32:52 2015 +0200

    Fix slowdowns when showing nav items
    
    Should finally fix #397
    
    Instead of having the nav items receive notification about which repo is
    loaded (so they can properly update themselves), have the home section
    (which loads first) propagate that information to the nav items (because
    it has it).
    
    This seems to fix the slowdowns, perhaps because now only one class is
    listening to the PropertyChanged event that is triggered when the active
    repo changes, instead of all of them.
    
    Also, disable the issues button for now, until I figure out if the delay-load
    is affecting things.

commit 4b0773e678d0d711762b76d19adbf97c88fa7b57
Author: Andreia Gaita <shana@spoiledcat.net>
Date:   Fri May 22 11:53:40 2015 +0200

    Fix slowdown loading nav items
    
    It's really hard to reproduce, but from tracing VS, it looks like the
    Loaded callback was taking a bit long, and slowing down everything else.
    
    Nav items get notified about changes via the loaded callback, and
    there's really no need for things to happen on the main thread until
    it's time to change visibility.

commit 4f2a4b539b0cde5196c634df9b612c5ef1bf8d7c
Merge: 9285d70d3 16737ba84
Author: Andreia Gaita <shana@spoiledcat.net>
Date:   Mon May 11 19:06:50 2015 +0200

    Merge pull request #390 from github/haacked/resharper-code-issues-fixes
    
    Resharper code issues fixes

commit af81bbfc48c362f498d27c5b6cfd448bf9485422
Author: Andreia Gaita <shana@spoiledcat.net>
Date:   Mon May 11 18:23:02 2015 +0200

    Fix loading resources assemblies
    
    There are some views that load very early, before VS has had a chance to
    set the proper load contexts. In some situations, it fails to load
    GitHub.UI when referenced from xaml because of this.
    SharedDictionaryManager has an assembly resolver, but it was in
    GitHub.UI so that wasn't going to help much.
    
    Move SharedDictionaryManager to the main assembly and merge it with the
    CachedResourceDictionary so that anything that tries to load resources
    from our assemblies is guaranteed to go through our assembly resolver,
    which knows where things are (in case VS is confused and doesn't know
    where things are).
    
    Fixes #382

commit 004408f1010f5048b68c37626ada386722604a0f
Author: Andreia Gaita <shana@spoiledcat.net>
Date:   Mon May 11 18:20:04 2015 +0200

    Add logger for non-NLog bits

commit 18da7a16bd10499ed1c18fc122e6db8d8dd50c1d
Author: Andreia Gaita <shana@spoiledcat.net>
Date:   Fri May 8 16:20:43 2015 +0200

    Set the unit test mode on splat in tests
    
    EntryExitDecorator goes through all public instance methods on
    most-derived classes from IEntryExitDecoratorInterface and adds
    OnEntry/OnExit calls (which are implemented in the TestBaseClass), so
    that every test manually sets the IsInUnitTest flag to true when it
    runs.

commit 1a8a49a5008b576aa6c5d101d25b316bd8f7b37f
Author: Andreia Gaita <shana@spoiledcat.net>
Date:   Tue Apr 28 21:29:39 2015 +0200

    Add another cache initialization fallback

commit 28e5a27f1606de32d9c781117e572048260534e6
Author: Haacked <haacked@gmail.com>
Date:   Mon Apr 27 16:20:00 2015 -0700

    Fallback if initializing BlobCache fails
    
    We hope this never happens, but Akavache uses Sqlite and you never know
    if some roque process or thread interferes and causes it to be bad.
    
    So when initializing the SharedCache, if anything fails we replace it
    with the InMemoryBlobCache. This is fine for our cases because the only
    cache that persists information that we can't recreate is the
    SecureCache. And hopefully that never fails because we're using the
    Windows Credential Storage rather than Akavache for that.
    
    This sort of Fixes #357, though it's more of a band-aid.

commit 052a1034ddcfd0205bb885994b1ba508988025bb
Author: Haacked <haacked@gmail.com>
Date:   Sat Apr 25 15:29:27 2015 -0700

    Remove MRU cache for images
    
    We always load images from the ImageCache and don't worry about trying
    to cache any in-memory. This is fast enough and more importantly,
    doesn't run out of memory.
    Fixes #334

commit 9c8e0ac85b3c89ac9f1ebdee3e335b9ff7b2e790
Author: Haacked <haacked@gmail.com>
Date:   Sat Apr 25 15:14:42 2015 -0700

    Set DecodePixelWidth and Height to 32
    
    Since we show 16x16 images, we can decode the image to 32x32 (for high
    dpi displays) rather than load the entire image into memory and then
    scale it down.

commit b26524ce204be9b02eaa36112017258d9f9be68a
Author: Haacked <haacked@gmail.com>
Date:   Sat Apr 25 14:49:19 2015 -0700

    :fire: We don't need the GravatarProvider
    
    We only use this for showing avatars related to a commit. Since we don't
    do that, we don't need this.

commit 2144373190d2ab770c0a54182e2e54088c9cf25f
Author: Haacked <haacked@gmail.com>
Date:   Fri Apr 24 17:09:34 2015 -0700

    Do not store token as username
    
    That will store it as cleartext in the windows credential store. Older
    versions of GH:E *might* have problems with this, but tough. The ones we
    support seem to have no problem with this.
    
    Fixes #338

commit bd9b48a55f3ee7f777cd48224c9c837c8c0c905a
Author: Haacked <haacked@gmail.com>
Date:   Fri Apr 24 16:45:29 2015 -0700

    Ensure we only return one user
    
    We had one case where the user's account was listed twice. I was unable
    to repro it and as far as I can tell, it should be impossible.
    
    I found one potential case where it could happen, but it's a case that
    should, as far as I can tell, never happen. But every time I say that,
    it happens. So I put in a defensive check.
    Hopefully Fixes #334

commit 5cbe2dcaaec0f62052bec3d69c2c750b42cd7914
Author: Andreia Gaita <shana@spoiledcat.net>
Date:   Wed Apr 22 15:17:50 2015 +0200

    Fix race condition loading the host list, and also resetting notifications
    
    There's a bit of a race condition when loading the control for the first
    time, the hosts are in the process of logging in and might not have the
    IsLoggedIn flag set yet. We can trust that all the connections in the
    ConnectionManager are valid and are the ones we'll use, so use that list
    to populate the hosts dropdown. By the time we need the actual host,
    it'll be ready.
    
    Also, reset notifications that are host-specific when changing host.

commit fd11fd820c951c44c4889701d95660aecea2bb21
Author: Andreia Gaita <shana@spoiledcat.net>
Date:   Tue Apr 21 16:20:12 2015 +0200

    Only clear credentials manually if RepositoryHosts is not loaded
    
    If RepositoryHosts has been loaded, it will register a callback in
    DoLogin and we can trust that it will clear credentials on logout. We
    only have to do it manually if RepositoryHosts has never loaded.

commit a76ecdeadee5df910672e8022929c7686be1cf8d
Author: Andreia Gaita <shana@spoiledcat.net>
Date:   Tue Apr 21 15:19:42 2015 +0200

    Make the dispose pattern the same across all our classes, for consistency.
    
    We currently don't have native resources to dispose so we don't have any
    finalizers that call Dispose(false), making most of these checks
    redundant, but it's easier to just have the pattern implemented in the
    correct safe way so it never fails and is easy to copy paste around.
    
    I debated whether to have the if(disposed) check inside or outside the
    if (disposing) check. Since we're only disposing managed resources, and
    some of the dispose code will only run safely if *not* called from a finalizer
    (it's not safe if disposing == false), I'm treating disposed as a
    flag for having managed resources disposed. If we ever do need finalizers,
    we can revisit this on a case-by-case basis.

commit 980936a69c757aecbd362176567a3e996b800e1a
Author: Haacked <haacked@gmail.com>

    :fire: Remove unused method

commit 72fdde153ddcf401cd7ec2527bc9572b05d7aa9c
Author: Haacked <haacked@gmail.com>
Date:   Mon Apr 20 11:25:44 2015 -0700

    Ensure we dispose things properly
    
    When we login (from cache or otherwise) we add the RepositoryHost to the
    disposables collection to be disposed when the RepositoryHost is
    disposed. When we logout, we dispose of the host by removing it from the
    disposables collection.
    
    When `PackageBase` is disposed, we dispose `RepositoryHost` which
    handles just about everything.
    
    The tricky part is figuring out who should dispose what. For example,
    multiple classes import `ISharedCache`, but I had
    
    Fixes #153

commit 024cc57dff3927ea039b582aa600c1dfba0f4de5
Author: Haacked <haacked@gmail.com>
Date:   Mon Apr 20 09:06:34 2015 -0700

    Fix NullRef when viewingcontrols in the designer

    used the xaml to bind to the design time DataContext. Since we also bind
    in the code-behind, I believe at runtime the codebehind takes
    precedence, though in truth it probably doesn't matter because we set
    the DataContext correctly in both cases.
    
    Fixes #163

commit a8e62e302976ca96d12b44a388af580eaafd57f5
Author: Haacked <haacked@gmail.com>
Date:   Fri Apr 17 00:13:31 2015 -0700

    Stream repositories to and from api and cache
    
    Prior to this change, we would request _all_ the repositories for the
    current user before we displayed them. For most users, this won't be a
    problem.
    
    For users like me, it's a big problem. The dialog appears to hang. With
    this change, we take the same approach as GitHub for Windows and we
    request repositories in chunks.
    
    - Current User's owned repos
    - Current User's member repos
    - Repos for each org the user is a member of
    
    Note that each individual grouping could represent multiple HTTP request
    because of paging. We still aggregate all the requests for each grouping
    and cache that all under a single cache key. Even so, this greatly
    increases the responsiveness of the Clone dialog.

commit d0cae9fa37025b44ed03ec37c657ad099c773940
Author: Haacked <haacked@gmail.com>
Date:   Thu Apr 16 21:26:24 2015 -0700

    Include username in cache key for orgs and repo

commit 5c3d977aa5ad215785c4818b551df75469891089
Author: Haacked <haacked@gmail.com>
Date:   Thu Apr 16 20:05:09 2015 -0700

    simply strip the quotes.

commit c87f5223f0e42074303b7f0f82d0823d89ced1e4
Author: Haacked <haacked@gmail.com>
Date:   Thu Apr 16 19:51:46 2015 -0700

    Check for invalid path characters before combining
    
    We have a race condition here where the base path validator might not
    have updated yet. So we just double check that we can combine the paths.
    Fixes #231

commit 3c7bd8bac24c147085406cb7ffa5961cf1a21344
Author: Haacked <haacked@gmail.com>
Date:   Thu Apr 16 10:52:40 2015 -0700

    Ensure create dialog does not crash for Enterprise
    
    It's possible an older GitHub Enterprise instance doesn't have the
    License endpoint. This change makes sure we don't crash in that
    scenario. Instead, we just show an empty list of license choices.
    
    Fixes #239

    smaller.

commit c83fd97338ffb8c5063416b406f6c7194ad9c8f9
Author: Haacked <haacked@gmail.com>
Date:   Mon Apr 6 15:42:57 2015 -0700

    Replace ConnectionViewModel with a service class
    
    This refactors how we map a connection to a repository so it's a bit
    more reusable and cleaner.
    
    - Got rid of the ConnectionViewModel (fragile base class).
    - Added the ConnectionRepositoryHostMap class (and interface) instead.
    - The RepositoryPublishViewModel no longer inherits ConnectionViewModel
    since it allows selecting the connection.
    - Refactored existing view models to import
    IConnectionRepositoryHostMap. This reduces the ctor parameter count in
    some cases. A nice benefit!

    Create connect sections and track connections on them
    
    Support up to 5 different connections concurrently. When connections
    are added to the connection manager, connect sections are shown for
    them, and operations started from them (clone, create) get a connection
    object to contextualize what they're operating on (added to our service
    provider via a temporary service container)

    Refactoring, navigation and lifetime of mef
    
    Extract interfaces of mef exports to separate dll
    to decouple things a bit.

    TeamExplorer items should not load any reactive stuff.
    Introduce ExportFactory to dispose of IDisposable mef
    components properly.
    Start fleshing out team explorer implementation.
